items.title: The culture-to-cognition transmission of inequality and the psychological necessity of consciousness-raising
items.author: Karim Bettache
items.content: Consciousness-raising interventions aimed at addressing social inequities often generate intense polarization and backlash. In this Review, Bettache demonstrates that such interventions are a psychologically necessary response to harmful cultural schemas and that resistance to these interventions is a predictable reaction to schema disruption.

items.title: The relational nature of visual working memory
items.author: Cate Trentin
items.content: The relational nature of visual working memory

items.title: Psycholinguistic perspectives on face-to-face conversation
items.author: Anna K. Kuhlen
items.content: Language production and comprehension are often studied as separate processes, but they are intertwined in naturalistic conversation. In this Review, Holler and Kuhlen summarize how visual signals, feedback and multi-party interactions contribute to language processing and require further study.
